who_we_are.title: Who are we?
who_we_are.description: We are a fundamental church dedicated to the family. Our purpose is to be a Biblical, Christ-centered, and missionary church that serves the Hispanic population. We believe that the Word of God has the answers mankind needs, and we strive to preach and teach it correctly. If you are looking for a place to congregate or are interested in knowing more about God,
who_we_are.welcome: we will extend to you a warm welcome!
who_we_are.description_hispanic:
Are you searching in this world, in vices, in money, for the peace that only God can give?
Christ is the answer! We invite you to our church. We are a church that understands the needs of the Hispanic community. We are a Fundamental and Independent Baptist Church that preaches and practices the Word of God, preached and taught in Spanish. It doesn't matter if you are young or an adult. We are sure you will find friendly people and a warm welcome when you visit our church.

testimonials.title: Testimonials
testimonials.bible_msg: “Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.”

our_pastor.description: Pastor Roberto Goins and his family have dedicated their lives to the service of the Lord. They began their ministry in South Carolina, serving the Hispanic community for almost 12 years. In 2005 they gave their lives to Christ, and their calling was strengthened thanks to the cultural connection with Colombia, the country of origin of his wife. Today, guided by God, they work in Arizona planting a church centered on the eternal principles of the Word. Their greatest desire is for every person to know the true peace and joy that can only be found in a relationship with Jesus Christ.

salvation.title: Can someone know for sure they will go to Heaven when they die?
salvation.intro: A deep question with an answer that can change your eternity.
salvation.content: It’s a difficult question. If we think only based on what we can see with our eyes, no one can truly know until they are dead. But not everything that exists must be seen to know it is real. We exercise our faith every day. By faith, we leave our house trusting there will be oxygen to breathe, even though we don’t see it; otherwise, we would all carry an oxygen tank. By faith, we trust that the food served at a restaurant is clean and edible, accepting it based on the word of the one who sells us the tacos. Faith is essential to our entire existence. Why is it so hard to believe what God says in His Word? He tells us how we can be sure we are going to Heaven when we die.
